channel.title: 508 Mapdata
channel.description:
So basically, a 508 server (or at least the one I'm working with) has it so that there's a whole folder filled with .txt files that have numbers in them that look similar to this: [code]914357934 960797390 753237255 -1274576207 [/code]
So basically, if you don't have the mapdata (those .txt file) for a certain area, it will freeze the client... I was wondering if there was a better way of handling this or getting rid of it all together (and have the maps still work of course). If anyone has ideas please shoot them my way!
Thank-you, RuneWings317

item.title: 508 Mapdata
item.dc:creator: @PvP_Bobby PvP Bobby
item.description:
@PvP_Bobby wrote:

Well assuming that you have to parse the .txt files anyway, why would it take long to convert to XML? Take that parsed data and smash it into an object that has 3 ints and then spit out that list using XStream or something like that. This is all depending on how the text files are being parsed anyway lol. There are ways to make your life easier, just gotta make em first

Read full topic

item.title: 508 Mapdata
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

I haven’t. But I’m almost positive you can re-dump all the map data in a different format from the cache.

Converting it would take forever.

Read full topic

item.title: 508 Mapdata
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“PvP Bobby, post:3, topic:448967”]Well you need to mapdata so there is no getting rid of that… Uhh but if you want to make it look more pretty you could always just load them all up like normal and serialize them into XML.[/quote]I just need a more efficient way to do this, cause I don’t think it’s possible to dump the .txt anymore I don’t know how much I want to waist my time converting to XML, cause in that time I could be working on a way to get a new way of handling it. Also, it’s not via the client, it’s in the server (IDK if you’ve ever worked with 508 or not) :S

Read full topic

item.title: 508 Mapdata
item.dc:creator: @PvP_Bobby PvP Bobby
item.description:
@PvP_Bobby wrote:

Well you need to mapdata so there is no getting rid of that… Uhh but if you want to make it look more pretty you could always just load them all up like normal and serialize them into XML.

Read full topic

So basically, a 508 server (or at least the one I’m working with) has it so that there’s a whole folder filled with .txt files that have numbers in them that look similar to this:

914357934 960797390 753237255 -1274576207

So basically, if you don’t have the mapdata (those .txt file) for a certain area, it will freeze the client… I was wondering if there was a better way of handling this or getting rid of it all together (and have the maps still work of course). If anyone has ideas please shoot them my way!
